    Current page:  GEOP
                                        
    		Geography & Planning Home
    	Choose Geography!Geography invites critical and creative thinking about our impact on the Earth, the equal distribution of resources, and sustainable living across the globe. Our programs cover social, cultural, economic, and natural science topics including landscape analysis, water resources, fire management, landscape ecology and biogeography, ecological restoration, climatology, and climate change.
                        What it's like being a Geography & Planning Student at California State University, Chico
                          Majors     Minors CertificatesFaculty & Staff   Resources    Alumni  GeoPlaceMap GalleryQuick LinksUniversity Catalog(opens in new window)Academic AdvisingFaculty & StaffDept Tutor Info
                        Announcements
                    FALL 2023 class registration is OPEN.  Geography Majors, Minors, & Certificate holders: have you met with your Geography & Planning faculty advisor(opens in new window) yet?  Not too late! Note for our Distance Learners:  did you know you can access GIS software remotely via Chico State's online Wildcat Lab?  Wildcat Lab is a cloud service (web browser-to-PC) with over 50 software programs licensed by our campus. The computer-in-the-cloud has programs that you would find in our on-campus labs, including ArcGIS Desktop and Pro programs. To view a full list of the software, visit the Wildcat Lab webpage(opens in new window).Academic tutors are available in the College of BSS Student Success Center, Butte 518 lounge. Our GEOP-specific tutor, Andrew Macias, has walk-in hours there.  Check out the Center's Spring 2023 walk-in hours(opens in new window) or just drop in to hang out, print out, or relax.  Everyone is welcome!Geography in the News: The Climate-Conscious College(opens in new window), article interview with Professor Mark Stemen et. al., by The Chronicle of Higher Education, Feb. 13, 2023.Faith Churchill, a geography and planning student earns recognition for her project in helping Chico State to become a designated safe-place for beneficial pollinators. Learn more about the article(opens in new window)See the 2020 issue of Chico State Today with Dr. Jacquelyn Chase and Peter Hansen on their work on "population displacement due to the 2018 Camp Fire".Learn more about the article (opens in new window)Don Hankins' interview with NPR's Science Friday in a segment about "how indigenous burning practices could prevent massive wildfires.Click here to listen to his segment.(opens in new window)College of Behavioral & Social SciencesButte Hall, Room 701530-898-6171bss@csuchico.eduwww.csuchico.edu/bssSupport Our CollegeProgram PortfolioBSS Majors & ProgramsAnthropologyChild DevelopmentEconomicsGeography & PlanningPublic Health & Health Services AdministrationMulticultural & Gender StudiesPolitical Science & Criminal JusticePsychologySocial ScienceSocial WorkSociology
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
